gov.sandia.rbb.ui
Class RBBEventUI

java.lang.Object
  gov.sandia.rbb.RBBEventListener.Adapter
      gov.sandia.rbb.RBBEventListener.Accumulator
          gov.sandia.rbb.ui.RBBEventUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
RBBEventListener
public abstract class RBBEventUI
extends RBBEventListener.Accumulator

RBBEventChangeUI addresses two needs for Swing programs that update in response to changes in RBB Events:

First, it dispatches notifications in the Swing event-dispatching thread, so it is threadsafe to do GUI-related processing in the callback. (RBB EventListeners, on the other hand, are called in a different thread).

Second, it allows the GUI to update in a lazy fashion. If one RBB Event is modified, then it is likely that others will soon be modified as well. So waiting until things settle down before redrawing reduces churn. This is controlled by the laziness and impatience parameters to the constructor.

To use this, you must override eventChageUI, which will be called in the Swing thread, and add the RBBEventChange UI as a listener (by calling addEventListener) on an RBB, or on an EventCache.

Constructor Detail

RBBEventUI

public RBBEventUI(int laziness,
                  java.lang.Integer impatience)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Parameters:
rbb: - rbb in which event changes are of interest. This same instance will be provided in the notifications.
tags: - tags of events of interest
swingListener: - will be called in the Swing Event Thread with Event changes.
laziness: - milliseconds to wait after one event change to see if additional events change before firing the action.
impatience: - to prevent starvation, stop being lazy after this many milliseconds, even if event changes continue to occur steadily. May be null (infinite).
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
